p:
We find that antigenic fitness is able to explain much of the observed variation in serotype growth and decline ( Figure 5). Forward simulations under the optimized parameter set display damped oscillations around the serotype-specific ‘set points’ determined by intrinsic fitnesses, but intrinsic fitness alone is unable to explain serotype fluctuations (
R 2
= 0.04
; Table 3, Figure 5—figure supplement 2). This demonstrates that although intrinsic fitness plays an important role in dictating long-term dynamics, wherein particular serotypes tend to circulate at low frequency (e.g. DENV4) and others at high frequency (e.g. DENV1 and DENV2), antigenic fitness plays out on shorter-term time scales, dictating circulation over several subsequent years.
